args: (I'm not sure I'm even capable of coming\nup with a tea party that could satisfy the\nolder-brother king... He's so scary!)
You wish a do-over for the tea party?
Bwah! Who's that?! Where are you?!
Right here, my dear. Riiight here.
Eeek! Odetta?! Where'd you come from?!
Odetta? Why, I am the Cheshire Spider,\nthe contrarian and curiously cryptic\narachnid of the Kingdom of Balberia!
Call me whatever you want. I am me.\nThat is all I am, and all I shall be.
But for now, the more pressing issue is you\nwanting a do-over for the tea party, yes?
I dunno. I worry I'll just mess it up again\nif I try it on my own.
Then why not get help from someone else?
Excuse me, but would you mind helping\nme do the tea party aga...
They all returned to the castle once the\ntea party came to its rather abrupt end.
Were I you, I would be hurrying along\nafter them and asking for help.
But she's right! I have to go to the castle\nand ask people for help!
Why hello there, sweet little lady.\nThat was quite the trouble earlier, mmm?
Our elder-brother king is always like that.\nThink nothing of it.
But if we don't do something, the younger\nbrother is going to rot away in jail!
Please, you have to help me do the\ntea party again—but better this time.
And WHY must we help with that?
Because he threw his brother in JAIL?!
Oh, his older brother is ALWAYS getting\nangry and throwing people in jail! If we\nworried about that, we'd never stop.
Plus, it's not like we were hosting that\ntea party because we LIKE doing it.
Affirmative. No one wants to plan a party\nwhere the guest of honor will get angry\nand yell at you no matter what you do.
Oh yes. In fact, the entire tea party idea\nstarted as one of his mere whims.
At first, we put all of our effort into hosting\na fine party—I mean, he IS the ruler of the\nkingdom, after all.
We all thought the finest tea and sweets\nwould make for a lovely occasion.
But then the king suddenly got angry and\npunished our friend who was preparing it.
We don't know. And yet, the next thing we\nknow, he's ordering us to hold another one.
We didn't want anything to do with it after\nseeing what happened to the first person,\nso we chose to boycott it.
Apparently not, because the older-brother\nking was FURIOUS. He ended up sending\na whole host of our friends off to jail.
So the NEXT time, we prepared the most\nlavish party we could think of—but it still\nfell on the deaf ears of the older brother.
So we decided that since he's going to be\nenraged no matter what we do, we'd\nsimply host the strangest parties we could.
(So THAT'S why they let me hand out\nthe terrible tea and pancakes!)
We just keep having mad tea parties that\nend with someone being sent off to prison.
So I'm sure you understand why we don't\nwant to throw a tea party unless we're\noutright ordered to.
None of us wants to go to jail, so I'm sorry,\nbut we can't help you.
Well, NOW what do I do?
And also, what is the deal with the older\nbrother getting angry all the time, anyway?\nMaybe he'd tell me if I asked nice...
Begone, I say! Get out! Shoo!
Well, that was a total bust.
I say, are you seeking to know more\nabout our grumpy king?
I just want to find out why he hated the\nother tea parties so I didn't make the\nsame mistake with my do-over.
I see. Then come this way, child!
(This is amazing! How did you know\nthere was a secret path that connects to\nthe room's fireplace?!)
(Because I am a mouse, dear girl.)

(Now then, you can remain unseen here
and watch the elder-brother king for as
long as you like—but be quiet as one of
my kind, or you'll be done for.)
How dare they prepare such half-hearted\ntea and treats! I simply will not have it!
(Yes, but he's always that way, so your\nmistake alone can't be the only reason.)
Bah! Everywhere I look, I find people who\nsimply cannot read the room!
Their parties are naught but surface-level\nentertainment—and in their secret hearts,\nI know they mock me!
The tea party with my younger brother\nseemed to be such a fun time, yet when\nI attempted to do the same thing...
At first, we put all of our effort into hosting\na fine party—I mean, he IS the ruler of the\nkingdom, after all.
We all thought the finest tea and sweets\nwould make for a lovely occasion.
Sadly, we never did figure out why he was\nso angry about everything.
Yeah, and I have to head back and tell\neveryone else what I've learned!
Oh dear. I hope that girl is okay...
